website_summaries.verdict: Highlights here include 7 LED visible alert lights and the ability to mute it or put it on sleep mode, depending on the time or day.
pros: Comes in a variety of designs
Has a total of 8 tones, with 90 decibels of adjustable sound
Receiver can connect to up to 6 transmitters at a time
Includes several modes you can set it to, as well as a visible alert LED
cons: Some reports of the ringer only working intermittently

customer_reviews.title: Scotty, give me full power!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first wireless doorbell I've found that can reliably penetrate the foot-thick brick wall on the front of my house. Thank goodness I found it, as the wife was demanding a wired solution, something I'm too busy to do and too cheap to pay someone else to do.
customer_reviews.author: Jon OBRIEN

customer_reviews.title: Bad button design
customer_reviews.text: Button bad design, after 3-1/2 months of use the prongs on the mounting brackets broke off. The mailman was actually standing at my door with the button in his hand. Said he pressed the button and it came off. After contacting Honeywell several times, sending pictures they finally agreed to send a replacement button. Guess what same thing happened again. I found their customer service difficult to deal with, kept getting transferred and insinuated I was the problem. Simply bad design of the button.
customer_reviews.author: AML

customer_reviews.title: Super great!
customer_reviews.text: Love this doorbell! I didn't want to drill any additional holes in my walls, so this is perfect. I got an extra button so we have one at our front door and one at the back and both work wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Ceci Dadisman

customer_reviews.title: I like the base unit
customer_reviews.text: The Base Door Bell Unit is neat. There are a lot of options, I only rated this 3 stars though because the door bell push button must be held for 3 seconds until the red light comes on for the doorbell to chime. Since everyone is not going to know this they will push the button and nothing will happen. I ended up using my old Honeywell doorbell push button and programming the new base unit to it. I moved the old Honeywell base unit into the basement. If I would not have had this option, I would have returned it. I like the base unit. Honeywell, fix the push button. David
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product with a 2 flaws
customer_reviews.text: I liked the deep sound that is why I wanted to rip out the existing wireless Chime with a puny sound that worked fine with two plug in receivers that worked fine. Its easy to setup hate the 4 C cell requirement should have been a Plug in like the Series 3 or 5 not sure anyone needs the portability that Honeywell was aiming for. The other major flaw is the lag in pressing the bell and the time it ring its is a good 2 seconds plus not sure why other reviewers have pointed that out. That's why my 4 stars instead of 5.
customer_reviews.author: Khalid Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this, has lithium batteries in doorbell
customer_reviews.text: When I moved in this house, I always said, should have a doorbell. we live rural, and family room is where we are the most, and cannot hear when someone knocks. Saw this on amazon while looking around....This was it! Ordered and came today, my husband had it up and doorbell in in 15 minutes! Yes, that fast. I highly recommend this, has lithium batteries in doorbell, and the speaker box (?} requird 4 C batteries, its awesome. Put in up high on wall center of house, out of the way, its better than I thought. Very very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: NANA

customer_reviews.title: Doorbell button response lags
customer_reviews.text: After a few weeks, the button does not work unless you hold it in for several seconds. The light on the button changes so the person at the door thinks the doorbell is ringing, but it is not. Who holds a doorbell button in that long?
customer_reviews.author: VKS

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good!
customer_reviews.text: I hesitated to make this purchase based on reviews of delayed and sometimes absent bell rings. I live in a older home with plaster walls. I found the doorbell signal would not reach the chime when placed upstairs (roughly 50ft). It seems to work just fine on the first floor level (roughly 20ft). It was easy to setup, the components are of reasonable quality and I like the fact it uses C batteries. Current rating based on me having this system in use less than 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett E. Coble

customer_reviews.title: Very inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this unit for about a year, and it's just never seemed to work quite right. I replaced the battery after a few months, and I do think the battery that came with it really had died, but changing the battery didn't change the fact that it's just not working consistently. You have to press it two or three times to get it to actually ring. Another reviewer suggested holding it down until it lights up. Even then, though, sometimes the button lights up but the receiver doesn't ring. I went back and forth with Honeywell support, but eventually they just stopped responding.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Update your door bell system and forget needing wires!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and program. The sound is very good and no wire connections need to be made. This unit runs off of 4 C-Batteries and the button door bell (that lights up when pressed) transmits quickly to the inside unit. This replaced the house's original 1970 door bell that always look awful on the wall in our living room. This unit is smaller and works better in today's world! There are ringer choices and this product is a win-win in my world. Check out the video that tells about this item.
customer_reviews.author: Dubbie

customer_reviews.title: Great for hearing the doorbell from the back yard
customer_reviews.text: I use this portable chime in the back yard so I can hear when someone rings the front doorbell. I use it in conjunction with a Series 5 plug-in chime, which rings inside the house. Since the chime unit is NOT waterproof, when we are not outside I store it in my gas grill's cabinet, which has the added benefit of blocking the signals from the pushbuttons...so the portable chime doesn't use up the battery ringing when we are not in the backyard.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce H

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money
customer_reviews.text: I bought it in January 2019 and it stopped working by June 2019. I changed the batteries in the doorbell on the chance the original batteries were bad. No good. Don't buy it. Read the other negative reviews. I believe if those who gave the really good reviews waited a few months they would find the doorbell is faulty and it would not have so many stars overall.
customer_reviews.author: J.G.J.

customer_reviews.title: Don't Depress The Mute Button Inadvertantly
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful doorbell set. Much smaller doorbell unit than it seemed in the photos. It does take 3 AA cells and does not plug in to electric as rumored. Offers several pleasing tones and colors to announce visitor. Pushbutton is attractive and was easy to install. I did accidentally depress the Mute button and when initially setting up didn't get any chime tones. Had to phone tech support who told me to depress the Mute button again for several seconds. This did the trick. The point is, the instruction manual is a bit abbreviated and does not offer troubleshooting steps. Still, it is a reasonably simple device and any idiot other than me should be able to proceed without much difficulty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: pretty good
customer_reviews.text: small and compact.price is consider cheaper than the rest of the bell.....the sound is very clear and loud....love when the button light up whenever it is pressed.....battery is included for the push button but not included for the speaker that use 4 x AA battery but all good.Thank you for the great deal
customer_reviews.author: Samad Z.

customer_reviews.title: Great programable wireless doorbell
customer_reviews.text: My old doorbell was 2 tone (ding dong) and I could not hear it in my office which is upstairs and in the back of the house. So I purchased two of these Honeywell units and put one downstairs and the other in my office. Now I have a 4 tone door bell which was easy to program and install. I have 3 buttons on my house enterances and anytime someone rings the doorbell I hear the 4 tone announcement all over the house. Great product. Multiple options just like the vendor description offered. I highly recommend this doorbell. Have not connected the motion detection option so can't comment on that option.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Standley

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable volume, nine selectable chimes, wireless connection - just what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item to replace the doorbell that was in the house when I bought it. The old one was obnoxiously loud and had an annoying chime, and this one has been the perfect replacement. I chose a tone I like, adjusted the volume so it wasn't overly loud but could still be heard, and I've been extremely pleased with its appearance and performance. There may be a short lag between pressing the button and hearing the chime, but it's one second or less. Some buyers have complained that the button has to be pressed and held until the chime sounds, but that's never been the case with ours.
customer_reviews.author: Bunsen Burner

customer_reviews.title: Works as described.
customer_reviews.text: It is nice and loud and it has worked perfectly for us. I wish it could be designed to look more like a real doorbell. I thought it looked rather random when I just stuck it on the siding next to the door so I made a little molded piece from a craft store to make it stand out a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Flyfisher

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I searched for a while in the sea of wireless doorbells. At the end I decided to go with a more expensive but known brand because reviews on other doorbells were mixed like the doorbells would go off for no reason or not go on at all. Installation was easy - peel the sticky paper, stick the doorbell outside and plug in the chime. There are plenty of options for chime sounds, we didn't need 100 choices, what's on there is plenty. We had it for about a month and no issues. The only thing that would be nice if it came with an option for 2 chimes, I could use one in the basement.
customer_reviews.author: Solnishko

customer_reviews.title: Best doorbell I ever come across
customer_reviews.text: Best doorbell I ever come across. I bought cheaper ones, don’t waste money, get this instead. Loud sound and super long battery life time of up to 5 years don’t have to change battery of main unit hard to beat. The door bell unit for visitor to press has a LED light to confirm it’s properly pressed. A lot of bell ring tones and light combinations to choose from. Easy to install. Leave the portable main unit anywhere you prefer, the small visitor doorbell unit, I used Blu-tack to stick on the wall outside my flat. Just stick and go, ready to use!
customer_reviews.author: reader

customer_reviews.title: Loud, but limited range.
customer_reviews.text: It's a wireless doorbell. It rings, loudly, and lights up. Unfortunately, and the prime reason for the 2 star rating is that the range on this doorbell is abysmal. It promises 500ft of range, but what I've found is that unless there is direct line of sight between the button and the speaker, I get less than 30ft. Buyer beware, this is definitely not a multi-story solution by any means. It also won't work through walls with any reliability. If you live in an open, single floor house or apartment, this is a great doorbell. If you don't, this is not the doorbell for you.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Finlayson

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life?
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this doorbell a little over a year ago as part of my home remodel. Great features, sounds and compact size. My ONLY reason for the low rating is the horrible battery life. Thank God for my bulk packs of AA batteries! Even though we have very few people ringing the doorbell it is dead within 3 weeks to a month and battety acid and corrosion that needs constant cleaning. Using Duracell batteries so not a battery issue.
customer_reviews.author: Orlando

customer_reviews.title: Tech Specs are incorrect
customer_reviews.text: In the specs it states that this unit requires 2 CR123A batteries,THAT IS INCORRECT. The unit actually requires 4 type "C" batteries. Make sure you have those on hand do not order the CR123A batteries
customer_reviews.author: M. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Often doesn't ring.
customer_reviews.text: I read in other reviews that this unit often doesn't ring, but I thought I would take a chance. While testing it before installation it seemed fine. The first time someone tried to ring my doorbell after installation it didn't work and after that only every so often. (even pressing the button firmly for two seconds) Too bad, I really loved the custom ring tone.
customer_reviews.author: Brahm

customer_reviews.title: Cheap button
customer_reviews.text: While the speaker works as intended and is of good quality the actual doorbell is a cheap piece of poorly designed plastic. In order for it to work every you should fold a small piece of paper inside to tighten the connection. It breaks easily so be careful choosing a sound kids will want to do repeatedly. I had to replace the doorbell itself after 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Techno Redneck

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: People have stated that the button needs to be pressed for a second or two in order to trip the doorbell. This isn't true. Just pressing the remote button once will trigger the receiver after a short delay. Works well. Easy to upload an MP3. Just plug it into your PC/MAC and copy the MP3 file over as you would onto a flash drive. Flashing lights and whatnot are also good for those of less than perfect hearing or when the unit is muted.
customer_reviews.author: Ursan

customer_reviews.title: Easy and works perfect
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Easy and works perfect. Didn't have to screw in button. Kept the screws just in case it ever falls.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Useful and configurable for numerous needs and situations
customer_reviews.text: I put this doorbell on my home office desk, with the push button mounted right outside my office door. This way family members can ring before they come in so I won't be startled, especially when I have loud music playing or am wearing earplugs. With an additional remote push button they can summon me from downstairs, and because of the different chimes and light colors to choose from for each remote, I can easily tell which remote is being pressed. I am very happy with this doorbell, and I wonder why I didn't think of getting one sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Oregon Bird

customer_reviews.title: Easy, basic, just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: This doorbell was easy to install, and I like that the sound box does not need to be permanently mounted to the wall. We have placed on a shelf in our TV stand, and it is still perfectly loud enough to hear throughout the house. Only negative is the doorbell itself fell off the door once, but popped right back onto the bracket and has been fine since! Was a quick easy solution for us after buying our house and being left without one, thanks to the previous owners.
customer_reviews.author: canneb

customer_reviews.title: Huge impressive sound in a small package. your own music can play AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.text: Listen to this thing you can load mp3s on it. Put your own notifications. I have the star wars dark side music play whenever someone presses the doorbell. Just go to Zedge download the mp3 you want and hook this thing up with provided USB cable. couldn't be simpler.
customer_reviews.author: Crafty Man

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected. Works great.
customer_reviews.text: It works great and is a remote doorbell. There seems to be no issue with the ringer button being outside when the temperature is -20F. I picked the regular "ding dong" sound as all of the other sounds were kind of stupid. Then again, it does let you add your own mp3 sound file. I can find nothing to complain about, it just works and is loud if you turn up the volume. I really like that it's portable so if I'm working in the basement and expecting someone at the door I can just take it with me.
customer_reviews.author: BCG

customer_reviews.title: If you have dogs, this is the doorbell for you. Brilliant.
customer_reviews.text: If you have dogs, this is the doorbell for you. Brilliant. Lights up bright when someone rings the bell with no sound so you can make it to the door before your dogs realize someone is at the door. It is wireless, portable so you can choose a place for it where you can best see it from anywhere in the house you most likely to be at the time you are expecting visitors. You can turn the sound on loud when you are at a part of the house you cant see it. You have several ring tones or you can make your own ring tone, easy enough to do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doorbell works well, but a bit slow
customer_reviews.text: It works pretty great with a loud and clear sound throughout the whole house, and I would've given it five stars if not for the fact that there's about a three-second delay between pushing the wireless button and the chime finally going off. That's long enough for most package delivery drivers to run back to their vehicles and speed off so they wouldn't have to actually interact with their delivery recipients.
customer_reviews.author: Jim R. Holden

customer_reviews.title: Good overall product, but software seems to be poorly developed and hard to configure
customer_reviews.text: Overall good product, well made and works, once set up. Reasons why not 5 stars: The overall product quality is good, but there are two things that would need improvement: 1. Mounting orientation of device should be not predefined (if both power blades would be narrow), lights could be facing down if preferred. Now they face up and not my personal preference 2. Pairing a door-bell with the receiver is not done as described in the step-by-step guide that comes with the product. Eventually I pressed multiple buttons and were able to pair the bell with the receiver, but the software seems to be developed cheaply by a less experienced person.
customer_reviews.author: Peter W.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup, works great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup, works great. The built in tones are deep and sound wonderful. I love that I could assign different tones and light colors to the back door and front door. Range is great - works in the basement as well as the main floor. I bought two units and paired both buttons to both receivers in a matter of minutes - very easy to setup.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Crow

customer_reviews.title: Useful doorbell
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use as an alert system for my recently blinded brother, and it works great! All he has to do is push the button and the doorbell rings, we know he needs assistance. It’s working throughout the house and even from the unattached garage. The tone is great, just the right sound to carry through the house but not loud enough to blast you out of your seat.
customer_reviews.author: lynda

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy for Hard of Hearing Senior
customer_reviews.text: I always startle my elderly mother when walking in but it doesn't matter how loud I am when coming in and she doesn't hear me knock or hear me talking until she sees me come around the corner. Now before I walk in I just use the door bell and she knows someone is coming in. She loves the chimes and can hear them over her LOUD TV!! The light works well too we just don't have a convenient place for her to see it so chimes will have to do for now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally, it arrived...
customer_reviews.text: It took three attempts to receive the correct "Plug-In" model (RDWL313P)...the first two delivered were the Battery Powered models.(RDWL313A).... It's here, it works as intended. I ordered a 6 outlet adaptor (GE $5), with tapered sides, each side having two outlets....the door bell covers the "top" two entirely....leaving 4 usable. Thankfully, this "contraption" is sight unseen... I think this wireless door bell is among the best of it's type available currently. Honeywell nailed it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Always shows a low battery
customer_reviews.text: Works great, love the look and the variety of places I can "hide" it. Fresh, new C batteries installed twice to make sure... the "low battery" light is always blinking. I may have gotten a returned unit, I bought a discounted price from the "warehouse". Still works fine, my doorbell rings maybe twice a month so it's not a big hairy deal, and I've got it placed behind some books so I can't see the light blinking.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Reinhart

customer_reviews.title: There are other doorbells that seemed to be better in one category
customer_reviews.text: We held off awhile on getting a doorbell and when I researched wireless doorbells it seemed that Honeywell was the clear winner. There are other doorbells that seemed to be better in one category, maybe the doorbell was louder, claimed a better range, or had 52 chimes available. In the end I went with the Honeywell because you don't have to plug anything into a wall, it's a completely self-contained/battery operated unit, and I am familiar with Honeywell's product quality.
customer_reviews.author: cliff northon

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Went to hang the push button on my house, it didn’t stick. The plastic piece that holds the button in place busted because it fell 3 feet when i discovered the sticky strip was barely sticky and not going to hold the button... so now I have a whole doorbell I can’t even use.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: After numerous attempts to get this working properly, all ...
customer_reviews.text: After numerous attempts to get this working properly, all failed. I took out the batteries, put them back in again (at least 6 times). Tried to sync the button with the unit, and that would only work for a few days. Even changed the ringtone, after re-inserting the batteries, and that lasted 3 days. Finally, I gave up, and returned this product
customer_reviews.author: Brian F. Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Great Doorbell
customer_reviews.text: This is a great doorbell for the price. The only gripe I have with it, is that there's like a 2 second delay from when the doorbell switch is pressed, and when we hear it. I even tested the bell by putting it close to the doorbell switch, and it was the same thing. Wish there was some way to fix that problem, but other than that, I really dig it and it was worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: S. Irizarry

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality sound, works great.  Love the custom ringtones.
customer_reviews.text: High Quality. Much better than the tons of other $20 dollar wireless doorbells (one of which I'm replacing) Sound is clearer and has a lot of nice options. I was concerned at first that the space for custom mp3's was only 15mb. But if you use short files (I got mine from Zedge ringtones) you can fit quite a few on there. If you don't hear any sound at first make sure you take it off mute;)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Sound
customer_reviews.text: It is sufficiently loud, is easy to install, and has great quality sound. The various sounds are likely the real chime, bell, etc... not just a cheap sounding electronic version. I contacted the manufacturer to ask them if they had more chimes that I could download. They were not overly helpful about that. It appears that they can be readily downloaded from other sources online.
customer_reviews.author: Michiguy

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a flexible semi-smart doorbell and this filled the bill nicely. It is relatively unobtrusive and sits on a bookshelf out of view in the living room. The doorbell button is small and does not stick out like a sore thumb...like some of the competitors. The doorbell can be easily heard anywhere in our single story ranch home. I highly recommend this to someone who is looking for a wireless doorbell that has limited features.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great door bell
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to install I been using it for a while now so it took me a while to write a simple review . It does what it says the thing I liked was that it was indeed very easy to install and have it operational. It’s loud and you can control the volume and it has a lot of different ring tunes . I like it and I does the job great door bell
customer_reviews.author: ParrotsAmigos

customer_reviews.title: making our own doorbell is a PLUG
customer_reviews.text: We hung this on our wall below our other doorbell. This is ran on batteries so that is great. our old doorbell kept burning our the transistors. so I didnt want anything wired in the house. The best part is the MPG upload so we made some of our own doorbells which is so cool. The price for this was perfect and being a namebrand I know I was more than happy. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: JR Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Not your average doorbell
customer_reviews.text: This was probably my best purchase for my new home I am currently renovating. Effing love it!
customer_reviews.author: Christina G

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with the door button.
customer_reviews.text: Not happy at this time at all . The door button cover makes it impossible to place the battery inside. Honeywell could have installed the battery for you. I am beyond disappointed. Therefore, the jury is still out until I can install and snap open the door cover without breaking it. Other than that the door chime (bell) itself maybe working.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Raysor

customer_reviews.title: Short Life Span - Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our business in the peak of COVID. We are not allowing customers directly inside, so we installed a doorbell for them to alert us of their arrival. The doorbell worked great for the first month, and now it only works 25% of the time. Additionally, sometimes the button sticks and the doorbell will ring continuously until you press it again. I would never recommend anyone buy this for their home, or you would never know when someone was outside!
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Got for hard of hearing Mom, works wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: Used for several months now, great help for mom, the lights blink, so even when she has her hearing aids out, she knows someone's at the door. She takes the receiver into whatever room shes in and sets it out of the way where she can see it. The audio can be set pretty loud too, for those who aren't totally deaf
customer_reviews.author: michael l. umphrey

customer_reviews.title: Overall, terrific design
customer_reviews.text: We simply forgot to specify door bell wiring in our new house, and only realized it when we moved in. So I looked on line to see if there was such a thing as wireless door bells. You bet there is! I chose this one -- the top of Honeywell's line (but sill a bargain). It's a huge advance over the traditional old bells or chimes -- offering a full range of sounds, volume, alert lights, custom programming, etc., etc. Attractive, solid construction. Install consists of putting the speaker unit on a shelf and sticking the pushbutton to the door frame. Overall, clearly a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey R.

customer_reviews.title: No battery life !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Nobody EVER rings my doorbell but the batteries seem to die at least Every month or 2. The amount of $ I have spent on batteries, and they aren’t cheap, is not even worth it! Do not consider buying this unless you are willing to spend about a hundred bucks a year on constantly replacing the batteries. Awful.
customer_reviews.author: Bill T

customer_reviews.title: This door bell worked as desired
customer_reviews.text: This unit was relatively easy to install and worked as expected. However, you have to be careful not to touch the mute button or you may find that audio portion not working until you reset the mute button. This is the problem I had initially until I realized that I had inadvertently pressed this button. Otherwise this door bell works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond E Copeland

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I'm an acupuncturist, and I work in an office with other practitioners. I needed something that could alert me that a patient needs me without sounding too loud a noise. This is perfect. I hand the button to the patient and ask them to press it if and when they need me. I can place the box in front of me while it's set on silent. If the button is pressed, it lights up. Or, it's small enough to put in my pocket. Then I just have it set to a low level ring. It's just what I needed!
customer_reviews.author: N. C.

customer_reviews.title: No volume control
customer_reviews.text: You can't change the volume and if you can I haven't figured it out which means it's not that easy. It also started going crazy and would not stop ringing one day. We had to take out the batteries, wait a day and put the same ones back in and it worked normal again. But if you need an easy doorbell and can out the chime anywhere it does its job. Just know the noise is loud.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie N Santiago

customer_reviews.title: DOESN'T WORK HALF THE TIME
customer_reviews.text: I recently installed this doorbell and found that the bell only works intermittently. A short press works about half the time, then other times not at all. Holding the button in doesn't seem to work, either. Frustrating and useless. I returned it will buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: George Nolta

customer_reviews.title: Straight Line Range: 250FT
customer_reviews.text: Like all the doorbells I tested, the range was between 200 and 300ft; they ALL said they'd be 1,000. My test was done in FL (high humidity). The test was done outside with no obstructions.
customer_reviews.author: Rafiki

customer_reviews.title: Super cool!
customer_reviews.text: We all joke with my cousin that she's part horse, so we wanted a doorbell that could be programmed to NEEEEEIGHHHHH. Prayers answered! This doorbell was SUPER easy to program with my own mp3 on my computer. Just drag and drop. Can be operated with a power cord (micro USB) or C batteries. It also has really bright flashing lights for the hearing impaired.. Well done Honeywell!
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: I've had bad luck in the past with wireless doorbell kits - ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had bad luck in the past with wireless doorbell kits - they always work initially and then just stop after a little while. A handyman suggested I try Honeywell as he has one in his own home and they are known to be good quality. I'm a couple of months in and it's working perfectly. Great price, solid product.
customer_reviews.author: Asha0325

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: This doorbell is nice and convenient. I just used the adhesive to attach the button and it's working fine. The speaker is simple and smaller than expected so you can really put it anywhere within range. The chime options could be better but that's not super important to me. Overall I'd definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya

customer_reviews.title: A wireless doorbell that works
customer_reviews.text: Nice to finally have a wireless doorbell that works. We've been using it about two months with no issues. I like its portability. You might not want to get this if you have limited electric outlets, as you need to plug it in. It has a limited choice of ringtones, but we just wanted a straightforward sound, so it's fine. We searched high and low for a device that would sound more like a doorbell than a chime, and couldn't find one, so this was our compromise.
customer_reviews.author: Deshon

customer_reviews.title: Super Doorbell.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with doorbell. Has different ring tones that we used on doors so we know what door the person is at. The sound is really nice and we can hear it all through the houses (unlike the wireless one we got at a local store). Like the idea that we can take the ringer outside in the back yard so we will know if someone comes to the door if we are out there. The ringer is very attractive and like the way it lights up when the doorbell rings. Would definitely recommend this doorbell.
customer_reviews.author: Diane R.

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to install and operate
customer_reviews.text: 1) Open box 2) Plug in main unit 3) Insert battery into doorbell button 4) Raise/lower volume on side of plug in unit 5) Figure out which ringer sound you want at side of plug in unit 6) Attach button to outside door frame Done! Works great and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia C.

customer_reviews.title: Love it and it’s fun!
customer_reviews.text: Believe it or not I bought this for my son’s bedroom and it’s awesome. No plug in on his part so no complaining that I’m occupying one of his valuable outlets. It also offers a few smooth ring tones. The agreement is, when you hear the chime you come see what mom needs so mom doesn’t have to keep calling you! It works like a charm!!!!
customer_reviews.author: MRD

customer_reviews.title: Customizable for Endless Laughs
customer_reviews.text: This doorbell is the gift that keeps on giving! I love that I can upload mp3’s to customize my own chime. My current chime is a clip of MC Hammer’s “Can’t Touch This.” The five year old in me totally is going to do a farting doorbell at some point. I’m having way too much fun with this.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Super easy and works great!
customer_reviews.text: This unit couldn't have been much easier to install. You stick (or screw) the button outside, plug in the indoor piece and select your chime. That's it. The unit is on my first floor and is loud enough to hear in my basement or 2nd floor but my house is pretty open. The selection of chimes isn't huge and some of them are dumb but it's a doorbell and it lets me know when someone is at the door. It looks good, works well and was super-easy to install. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Vann J

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, great product!
customer_reviews.text: We moved into an apartment about 1000 square ft but have a longer hallway that separates the front door area from the rest of the apartment space and couldn’t ever hear knocking, purchased this and now we know when we have visitors! The doorbell itself is pretty loud we had to turn it down a little and can still hear it very well, the flashing light is just a bonus. Easy setup!
customer_reviews.author: Tabatha

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and doesn't scare the dog
customer_reviews.text: Our existing doorbell scared the dog. It was a trigger and would start a round of barking every time. This new doorbell has a volume control, so we can keep it fairly quiet (dog hasn't noticed yet). The lights are also a nice feature. Great for pet owners.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: I like it, it's loud enough for a large home
customer_reviews.text: I like it, it's loud enough for a large home, but it's somewhat difficult to get multiple devices set up with different ringtones. I have 5 currently, two motion sensors (honeywell RCA902N1004/N), two hardwired doorbells running through a wired to wireless adapter and one wireless doorbell. Also, the mute only has 3, 6, 9 and 12 hour temporary settings. 3 hours is too long for the first setting, I would've liked something like 1 hour for when I'm working around the motion sensors.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Deluca

customer_reviews.title: ... a 2-story house and the door bell wiring was bad. This was the perfect alternative to replacing the ...
customer_reviews.text: I live in a 2-story house and the door bell wiring was bad. This was the perfect alternative to replacing the door bell without having to replace the old wiring. The door chime is plugged into an AC outlet which means not having to worry about replacing the batteries. However, the push button still uses a CR-2032 battery and has to be replaced every so often. Wish the push button had a metal finish, but for the price it wasnt too bad. The door chime is not as loud as the old built in door bell system. However, it is loud enough to alert you when someone is at the door. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Gurak

customer_reviews.title: Good Gift
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic! I bought it as a gift for my dad. We preprogrammed some "favorite" song clips on the memory before we gave it to him. If you have a music lover you're buying for, this is fun to give. We were all cracking up when he rang the doorbell and some of the song clips played. Just think of all your favorite lyrics and how you can turn em into fun rings.
customer_reviews.author: Terese

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my door - the existing doorbell wires are broken. This doorbell is sleek and modern, minimal and works perfectly. It isn’t super expensive and doesn’t do more than I need it to do, which is simply to be a doorbell. Yet it does have easy extra features like mute and volume control that will be nice to have.
customer_reviews.author: J malinois

customer_reviews.title: Fun, not-to-smart doorbell!
customer_reviews.text: While everyone in my neighborhood is getting their $200 doorbells ripped off, I'm enjoying the versatility of my Honeywell. The transmitter has a great range, and the receiver has a nice speaker, and usb functionality for which I added my own mp3 to it so I hear music instead of some random weird high pitched ding.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Heitling

customer_reviews.title: Battery use
customer_reviews.text: I've had this doorbell for over two years and it has always used up the battery life quickly - and when they are drained, I never know until I think to try the doorbell. Within the last couple months, it drains the batteries within three weeks. The instruction booklet says batteries will last five years. Now, I have to look for another one but it won't be Honeywell!
customer_reviews.author: Larry Washburn

customer_reviews.title: Works great, very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Living in an old house, I can't get access to the crawlspace that's under where the front door is to run wiring. That's why I'm so happy with this wireless doorbell. The various options for volume, bell sound, and everything are very convenient. I just tucked away the base unit where I can get to it but it's not in the way, and it does exactly what I want it to.
customer_reviews.author: Chad A

customer_reviews.title: Really cool doorbell
customer_reviews.text: So I'm a millennial and I actually have a house so I had to do something stupid and immature, so I got this doorbell so I could make the ringer make fart noises. A+ recommend. Seriously though, it's a very nice doorbell, easy to install, customize, and mobile which is nice for our 3 level home.
customer_reviews.author: Ember U

customer_reviews.title: Very nice door chime!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful! Received package and within minutes the chime up and running. The tones are so realistic - not like the cheap ones. The finish is nice, and the front is a nice cloth speaker cloth covered grille. I like the strobe feature for those "did I hear the doorbell" moments. I can also pop it off the wall and take out on the deck if I want to. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Russell E Logan

customer_reviews.title: It works, you won't regret your purchase.
customer_reviews.text: This not only great for the hearing impaired but it's also portable from one room to another. I don't know about the battery life but I do know that you need 4 C lithium batteries which are expensive. There are several tones to choose from as well. And lastly the receiver also flashes, I'd say that is the weak point of this product.
customer_reviews.author: John Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Skip the wires. Easy, flexible, solid system.
customer_reviews.text: I waited a few months before writing this review in case I experienced problems. None! This is a great, flexible system. I bought an extra button so I could use both front and side doors with different bell tones for each. Worked like a charm, a piece of cake to set up. (If I can do it, anyone can.) Love being able to bring the chime anywhere, including our cellar or backyard. My hearing isn't so great either, so the strobe lights and volume setting are incredibly useful. I've read the negative reviews and I can't imagine how anyone could find any significant fault with this product. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Love this doorbell
customer_reviews.text: My sister had gotten one and honestly we love it. My six year old son loves to just ring the doorbell all of the time haha. It’s much easier to hear than a knock on the door. The light up feature is nice and it’s actually pretty loud. You can adjust the colors and sound to your preference. Would highly recommend. We have our just sitting on our walk in sorter and you can hang it if preferred.
customer_reviews.author: Kimmy

customer_reviews.title: Could work well...
customer_reviews.text: This little doorbell system combined with the wired to wireless doorbell adapter made our doorbells audible throughout the whole house. I bought 3 chimes (with unnecessary buttons) and set them up quickly. It's 3 months later and 1 chime has failed completely. It will not power on at all. I've got a support request in to Honeywell to replace it as I can't return it to Amazon already. I generally expect more than 3 months of operating life for a doorbell.
customer_reviews.author: Raja Ramanathan

customer_reviews.title: Nowhere near as loud as it needs to be
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly, for a device which plugs into line voltage, this doorbell doesn't get very loud. It replaces our much louder Honeywell 54159SL (for which we can't find a replacement door button). A real shame. We're going to work with it as best we can.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive upgrade
customer_reviews.text: These are a perfect modern day upgrade for an old doorbell. The door button is easy to install. The ringer unit has flashing lights as well as a ringing bell! You can take the ringer with you, upstairs, to the basement, wherever so you don’t miss someone at the door. Great inexpensive upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Obster

customer_reviews.title: Great solution to have a doorbell when wired doorbell not ...
customer_reviews.text: Unit works very well as described. Great solution to have a doorbell when wired doorbell not an option.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Mangold

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation, nice sound!
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't get much easier than this. Plug in the base unit, select your tone. Put the battery (included) in the ringer and choose a spot outside to either use the sticky back tape included or the screws to install. Ring, Ring...it works great and is inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: C. Sutherland

customer_reviews.title: Very awesome MP3 doorbell!
customer_reviews.text: The door bell operates at the 900mhz ISM band rand. Do not use it if you have electronics that also utilizes this R/F on this range or it might potentially ring every time when those electronics are in use. Otherwise, a very solid door chime with MP3 support and great audio quality. The onboard storage for MP3 is 16MB. The playback per ring is slightly short of 15 seconds. So, don't place full songs into the unit. Use an audio editor to cut 14-15 seconds clips and you have potentially more MP3s. Volume of MP3s depends on the songs used.
customer_reviews.author: Wong Hong Fei

customer_reviews.title: Works great and multiple choices for a ring is awesome
customer_reviews.text: My son added this to our house that we need it because our ears are not what they used to be. Now the volume can be set that we can hear it it has multiple rings that you can choose. We added an extension in our bedroom with a different ring. No we never missed the doorbell again.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Z

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Multiple bells may be used with one doorbell, Lighting when ringing helps hearing impaired, like someone with headphones on. I would like to see the ability for two different door buttons, for example, front and back door buttons to have different rings to identify which door has visitors.
customer_reviews.author: Charles S.

customer_reviews.title: Great look and easy to install & Operate.
customer_reviews.text: My house is not wire for a door bell. I needed a Wireless. Had one for a few years, it worked but it was not easy to see and worked erratically. This is the opposite, Easy to recognize and works every time.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Lockwood

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: really love this item. doorbell mounts outside and speaker can be mounted (or i leave free standing and move as needed). battery life is great and plenty of volume and choices. both sound and light indicators. love it.
customer_reviews.author: todd

customer_reviews.title: Solid Wireless Doorbell
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. I am impressed with the volume levels. I also like that it has a lithium battery which should last much longer on the external push button at door. It also offers flashing but we are not using that feature. I am happy w purchase. It has been in use for about 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Pam A

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple to install wireless doorbell which I can hear throughout my house so wherever I am, I can hear if someone comes to the door. Reasonable priced and a great addition for my new house..
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth A. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Switched product in box
customer_reviews.text: Ordered new - got used Ordered plug in got- battery power only Ordered bright strobe light - got mini LED power on indicator Amazingly the users manual says plug in and so does the box. Looks like someone bought a battery type and a plug in type and returned the battery type in the plug in box.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Pratt

customer_reviews.title: Barriers greatly reduce this doorbell's range.
customer_reviews.text: While the door bell does seem to come with all the bells and whistles I have two gripes with it. 1. There seems to be a delay of about a second from the time one presses the button until the bell sounds. 2. My biggest gripe however is the range of the bell. It's advertised at quite a decent range, but I have found that it is absolutely terrible operating through barriers. The bell failed to receive at a distance of about 30m when operating through 2 steel gates and a wooden door. To me that is rather dismal. In all honestly, I'm so fed-up with wireless doorbells. There just doesn't seem to be anything with a decent range.
customer_reviews.author: Jean-Paul Malherbe

customer_reviews.title: Great Doorbell. LOUD!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a neighbor who has difficulty hearing. Due to the construction of this unit she takes it with her to where ever she is in the house. Illumination when ringing is a nice touch, works well for dim lite rooms.
customer_reviews.author: DOBE

customer_reviews.title: Terrific product!
customer_reviews.text: I have never written a review before, but this doorbell is perfect. First I bought a generic wired doorbell replacement which turned out to be terrible sound quality. Then I bought a high end wired doorbell with a mechanical chime and it simply didn't work. I then tried a wireless bell which turned out to be totally unreliable. This bell has every desirable feature, great loud sound and is extremely reliable. Recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Don costello

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: It's a looker, does what it says on the tin, and the ability to play any MP3 you want is amazing. Beware! If you want to use this with a smart doorbell, you're going to have to purchase an adapter (which honeywell themselves sell) to hook up the chime to the circuitry. However, it WILL fit your use case if you pick this one, so I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo

customer_reviews.title: Buh-Bye wired doorbells!!
customer_reviews.text: We had to replace our old unit because the batteries leaked and killed it. New house blues. The new unit. With the existing button, so now we have the original plus another at a different door, both set for different rings. What a great option!
customer_reviews.author: WheezerMF

customer_reviews.title: Awesome doorbell
customer_reviews.text: Love these Honeywell doorbells this is my second, got it so I would extend the doorbell in to my garage. I wish the instructions would explain better how to pair additional devices to extend the range the back of the box lists this but nothing in the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: E. Reitz

product_meta.title: Honeywell Home RDWL917AX2000/E Doorbell Portable Wireless Doorbell & Push Button - 9 Series, Blue
product_meta.description: Style:Wireless Doorbell w/Push Button Halo LightNever miss a delivery or visit again. This Series 9 Portable Doorbell represents the finest in Honeywell design with innovative features ranging from downloadable tunes and custom visual alerts to the peace and quiet of a mute timer. You can also connect doorbells via Honeywell ActivLink for eve more extensive range and versatility.
feature_bullets: Adjustable volume, sleep mode and mute to adapt use for time of day
High-quality sound (90 db); comes with 8 tunes

specifications.Style: Wireless Doorbell w/Push Button Halo Light
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,564 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
